page.title: 03HISTORICAL SITES IN WEDMORE
page.content: There are over 130 listed houses in Wedmore.Our survey shows that after St.Marys the most popular building is{ {Porch House.}The present building was constructed in the 16th Cent. but the original house was built c.1490. It was inhabited by the Westovers and the porch was added in the reign of Henry VIII.In 1680 Dr Westover built a house next door for the mentally ill. In a wall are two medieval statues. {Stone Steps}in Church St. was built in 1870 by Solomon Wall,a builder,as an advert. It contains various types of tiles and chimneys and the walls were made of 2 different kinds of stone. {Gray's Chemist Shop}was built in the Italian style in 1830. The initialled bricks and unique fish_tail tiles were made in local works. It was a fashion house,is 3 storeys high and originally had a tower.
